name: A. k-th equality
statement:
Consider all equalities of form a + b = c, where a has A digits, b has B
digits, and c has C digits. All the numbers are integers and are written
without leading zeroes. Find the k-th lexicographically smallest
equality when written as a string like above or determine that it does
not exist.For example, the first three equalities satisfying A = 1, B =
1, C = 2 are 1 + 9 = 10, 2 + 8 = 10, 2 + 9 = 11. An equality s is
lexicographically smaller than an equality t with the same lengths of
the numbers if and only if the following holds: in the first position
where s and t differ, the equality s has a smaller digit than the
corresponding digit in t.
